question: Mahananda wildlife sanctuary, which is to conduct the ‘Bird Festival’, is located in which state?
explanation:
The Mahananda wildlife sanctuary in West Bengal is to organise a first-of-its kind Bird Festival from February 20-23 this year.
The Darjeeling Wildlife Division will organise the event, which will enable the applicants visit several bird-watching spots like Rongdong and Latpanchor. The Sanctuary is designated as 'important bird area', as it is rich in fauna with more than 300 species of birds including Rufous-necked hornbill.
